lines.text: [first lines]

play up and play the game, honor your queen and country, mind what your masters tell you, say your prayers each night, keep your minds and your bodies clean, take a cold bath each day, and you'll find you can always look the world in the eye like an English gentleman.
[audience members concurs, muttering "Here, here"]
Now my lads, I'm just a simple soldier.
[Audience members murmer objections and so does the headmaster]

Yes, I am though. But I tell you if you follow these rules, then when the last roll call comes, you'll be able to go up before the great headmaster with a clean, British conscience and say, "Well sir, I tried to do my duty", and I think, I think, you'll find that's good enough for him.
[applause and standing ovation from the audience]
Come down and fight like a man!
Don't be ridiculous!

[to Bismarck]
How dare you insult a lady, you dirty foreigner.
I shall remember you.
Well I shan't trouble to return the compliment.

[posing as Crown Prince Carl Magnus]
Highness, may I say... May I tell you...
[she turns to face him and he is struck by her beauty]
... you're the loveliest piece of tumble I've seen all year.
Never hit a man when he's down, he may get up.
You're not English, are ya?
I am a German officer, and I demand that...

[interrupting]
Yes, well, Captain Flashman is a British Officer, so you don't demand nothing.
I salute you, you animal.
Pish, to you!

[posing as Crown Prince Carl Magnus]
That's it, grovel, you commoners.
Lola, I love you, you selfish bitch!
